DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course End Therapy Intervention or Procedure Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date on which the patient completes or receives the last radiation treatment at any facility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Radiation Therapy End Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: When patient completes or received the last radiation treatment at any facility.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredName: Radiation Therapy End Intervention or Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: End Therapy Intervention or Procedure Date
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Activity or measure that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in patient or population. This is a general term encompassing medical, social, behavioral, environmental and other acts that can have preventive and/or therapeutic impact._a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
